page.title: 07FARMING YEAR IN GRAFTON
page.content: In the Spring we do quite alot of spraying to kill weeds and in the late Spring we cut the grass for silage that is cut and directly collected up and put in the silage pit. In early Summer we collect the hay which is grass, cut and left to dry before gathering. In the Summer we harvest the wheat and barley and take the grain in trailers to be emptied into sheds. It is then taken to be ground into powder for animal feed. In the Winter we bring in the cattle and put them in sheds to eat food like oats, hay and straw, or the cows may stay in a yard. During the year most of the cows have calves which we keep if they are cows but if they are bulls we sell them at the market in Stratford.
